item.title: Moving heads
item.dc:creator: @Odimaru Odimaru
item.description:
@Odimaru wrote:

Just get a brand new TestScape client.java and copy & paste the WHOLE thing into your version of the client.java. That would fix it… But that would mean you’d have to edit everything you had before you got the new client. I’d just re-download TestScape & do what I suggested in the 1st place =P

item.title: Moving heads
item.dc:creator: @download download
item.description:
@download wrote:

I was editting the project16 V.6 so it can print 2 lines of text in the dialogue and read the name from the file, but how can I get the head moving again, now the head in the dialogue window only stands still and does nothing it should turn around… this is the source coe:

	   public void UpdateNPCChat() {
      sendFrame126("", 976);
      if (server.dialogueHandler.DialogueType[NpcDialogue] == 1) { //npc 2 chat line (click here to continue) here is it ...
            sendFrame126(server.dialogueHandler.DialogueText[NpcDialogue][3], 4902);
//everything runs fine except the head...
            sendFrame126("", 4903);
            sendFrame126(server.dialogueHandler.DialogueText[NpcDialogue][1], 4904);
            sendFrame126(server.dialogueHandler.DialogueText[NpcDialogue][2], 4905);
            sendFrame126("", 4906);
            sendFrame75(NpcTalkTo, 4901);
            sendFrame164(4900);
      } else if (server.dialogueHandler.DialogueType[NpcDialogue] == 2) { //npc 2 option line
         sendFrame171(server.dialogueHandler.DialogueSword[NpcDialogue][1], 2465); //swords close to eachother
         sendFrame171(server.dialogueHandler.DialogueSword[NpcDialogue][1], 2468); //swords far away
         sendFrame126(server.dialogueHandler.DialogueQuestion[NpcDialogue], 2460);
         sendFrame126(server.dialogueHandler.DialogueText[NpcDialogue][1], 2461);
         sendFrame126(server.dialogueHandler.DialogueText[NpcDialogue][2], 2462);
         sendFrame164(2459);
      } else if (server.dialogueHandler.DialogueType[NpcDialogue] == 3) { //player 2 chat line (click here to continue)
         sendFrame200(615, 974);
         sendFrame126(playerName, 975);
         sendFrame126(server.dialogueHandler.DialogueText[NpcDialogue][1], 976);
         sendFrame126(server.dialogueHandler.DialogueText[NpcDialogue][2], 977);
         sendFrame185(974);
         sendFrame164(973);
      }
      NpcDialogueSend = true;
   }

Read full topic
